intro: Sapium acetosella var. lineare, commonly known as the slender Chinese broom. It is a flowering plant native to China, characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its compact growth habit and seasonal blooms.
